metadata.title: CVE-2024-22025 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
A vulnerability in Node.js has been identified, allowing for a Denial ofService (DoS) attack through resource exhaustion when using the fetch()function to retrieve content from an untrusted URL. The vulnerability stemsfrom the fact that the fetch() function in Node.js always decodes Brotli,making it possible for an attacker to cause resource exhaustion whenfetching content from an untrusted URL. An attacker controlling the URLpassed into fetch() can exploit this vulnerability to exhaust memory,potentially leading to process termination, depending on the systemconfiguration.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-22025` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnode109 - 18.19.1+dfsg-6ubuntu5
nodejs - 18.19.1+dfsg-6ubuntu5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nodejs package in oracular, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '18.19.1+dfsg-6ubuntu5').
